Posts.Content: Hi, I was wondering if anyone has been given Faslodex for a once a month treatment for met. breast cancer? Also, I was wondering if there is anyone out there that had breast cancer years ago, it coming back in the bones and if the dr's did a biopsy on one new tumors?
Posts.Title: Faslodex??

Posts.Content: On 7/28/2009 jjaquafit wrote:   On 7/28/2009 Milissalynn wrote: Hi my mom has metastic breast cancer that has gone to the bone. Her oncologist is wanting her to do a injection of strontium. I was wondering if anyone has had this done before. If so, What side effects did you have from this? Were you sick? that kind of stuff i would like to know. thank you. I have a friend right now in Mx with 4th stage breast cancer.  Her Dr. gave up but never told her the ending diagnosis. He sent her home with no hope. A nurse found out how terminal she is.  She is in Mx and doing fabulous. Go to http://cancersupport-center.com Hi, i guess i don't understand what you are talking about. what is Mx?
Posts.Title: Mets to the bone to receive Strontium

Posts.Content: On 7/31/2009 Sewwonderfulwoman wrote: Hi I'm a survivor who developed osteoporosis 2 1/2 years after treatment (I take Arimidex).  My naturopath put me on strontium (pills) and it has helped stabilize the bone loss.  Strontium helps the bones so it makes sense that your Mom's doctor wants to give it to her.  Have you asked the dr. about side effects and/or researched it online?  Good places to start.  Blessings to you both.  Thank you for getting back to me. the strontium she will be getting is a radioactive kind that is to go in and kill the cancer. Just like radiation they tell us. I have done a lot of research and there isn't a bunch of info on it that's why i thought i'd give this a try. Thank you and God bless you.
Posts.Title: Mets to the bone to receive Strontium

Posts.Content: Hi my mom has metastic breast cancer that has gone to the bone. Her oncologist is wanting her to do a injection of strontium. I was wondering if anyone has had this done before. If so, What side effects did you have from this? Were you sick? that kind of stuff i would like to know. thank you.
Posts.Title: Mets to the bone to receive Strontium

Posts.Content: On 7/28/2009 jjaquafit wrote:   On 7/28/2009 Milissalynn wrote: Hi my mom has metastic breast cancer that has gone to the bone. Her oncologist is wanting her to do a injection of strontium. I was wondering if anyone has had this done before. If so, What side effects did you have from this? Were you sick? that kind of stuff i would like to know. thank you. How old is your mom?  Did you take the traditional route?  My mom is 54 yrs old. The traditional route? as in standard treatments? yes she is. we aren't into the alternative medicines. We have known way to many people who depended on alternative meds who thought they were doing great and every single one of them passed on. I'm sure its good to go the alternative way to a certain point but not all the way. Am i understanding  you right?
Posts.Title: Mets to the bone to receive Strontium

Posts.Content: Hi, My mom to has metastic breast cancer that went to her bones. And including her spine...spinal cord. but by the grace of God she never did have paralysis. So don't just settle for what the dr's tell you. They are not God!!! are they not going to try her on chemo? or switch her meds? I wouldn't just let the dr's do nothing. Just because your mom is older doesn't mean she doesn't have the right to live until she is in her 90's if you understand what i mean. Get a second opinion!!! Get a fight going!!! Please do. you don't have to sit and let the dr's tell you when you are going to die. because the sad thing is when the dr's says this to people then its in their minds and they go down hill...Get a fight going ok!!!! Let me know how you and your mom are doing please!!!
Posts.Title: Breast cancer in spine...
